result.execSummary:
The defendant Rene R. Espinosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rene R. Espinosa is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rene R. Espinosa was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:03 am - Defendant Rene R. Espinosa in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Rene R. Espinosa in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information, Hogan waives reading and will proceed with plea and sentencing.  State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 3 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail 30 days - Jail credit 11 days - W/Huber for all purposes
Psychological evaluation
Any other conditions/counseling deeemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI given

01:21 pm - Defendant Rene R. Espinosa in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Rene R. Espinosa in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing. Hogan/Schiek statement to motion to modify cash bond - Currently set at $400 w/conditions.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

02:33 pm - Defendant Rene R. Espinosa in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states contacted PD office and was told Hogan would be assigned. Court adjourns.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
May not be on ANY Walmart premises

02:13 pm - Defendant Rene R. Espinosa in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
